prompt: A footer with a copyright notice, social media links, and a newsletter signup

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The footer should have a clean and simple design, with a clear hierarchy of information. The copyright notice should be prominently displayed, with social media links and newsletter signup form below it. On smaller screens, the social media links and newsletter signup form should be stacked vertically to ensure readability. On larger screens, they should be displayed side by side to make the most of the available space. **Components** * Footer (Standalone): The footer component will contain the copyright notice, social media links, and newsletter signup form. It should have a light gray background color and a subtle shadow to give it some depth. * CopyrightNotice (Standalone): Displays the copyright notice with the current year. * SocialMediaLinks (Takes Children): Container for social media links. * SocialMediaLink (Standalone): An individual social media link with an icon and a label. * NewsletterSignup (Takes Children): Container for the newsletter signup form. * NewsletterInput (Standalone): Input field for the newsletter signup form. * NewsletterButton (Standalone): Submit button for the newsletter signup form. **Top-level HTML** ```html

prompt: A post detail component that displays the title, date, and author of an article, along with a large image and detailed content

prompt: A navigation bar with a logo on the left and horizontal menu items on the right (white text on a black background)

message.content:
Here's the design and implementation of the navigation bar: **What should the UI look like?** The navigation bar should have a clean and modern design with a prominent logo on the left and horizontal menu items on the right. The background should be a dark color (black) to make the white text stand out. The logo should be easily recognizable and scalable on different screen sizes. On smaller screens, the menu items should collapse into a hamburger menu to save space. **Individual components:** 1. **NavBar** (Takes Children): A horizontal navigation bar with a logo on the left and menu items on the right. The background color is black, and the text color is white. * On smaller screens (mobile devices), the menu items collapse into a hamburger menu. * On larger screens (tablets and desktops), the menu items are displayed horizontally. 2. **Logo** (Standalone): A scalable logo component on the left side of the navigation bar. 3. **MenuItem** (Standalone): A single menu item with white text on a black background. **HTML for top-level UI:** ```html
Home About Contact
``` **HTML for each component:** - **NavBar** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - **Logo** (Standalone): ```html ``` - **MenuItem** (Standalone): ```html {menu_item_text} ``` Note: `logo_url`, `link_url`, and `menu_item_text` are placeholders for the actual values.

The button should be easily clickable on mobile devices and have a subtle shadow effect to give it depth. The UI should scale well on different screen sizes, with the button becoming larger on larger screens. **Components** 1. **FilterButton** (Standalone): A button with a white outline that filters job listings. * On mobile screens (sm:), the button should be full-width with a height of 48px and a font size of 16px. * On tablet screens (md:), the button should be 250px wide and 56px high with a font size of 18px. * On desktop screens (lg:), the button should be 300px wide and 64px high with a font size of 20px. **HTML for top level UI** ```html
Filter Jobs

prompt: A "Read More" button with a white outline and a subtle arrow icon

message.content:
Here is the design and implementation of the "Read More" button:

**What should the UI look like?**
The "Read More" button should be a rectangular button with a white outline and a subtle arrow icon. The button should be easily clickable on all screen sizes. The outline should be rounded to give a soft and approachable feel. The arrow icon should be small and subtle, indicating that there is more content to read.

**Components**

* `ReadMoreButton` (Standalone): A button with a white outline and a subtle arrow icon.

**HTML for top level UI**
```html
<button class="read-more-button">
  <!-- ReadMoreButton component -->
</button>
```

**HTML for each component**

* `ReadMoreButton` (Standalone):
```html
<button 
  class="bg-transparent hover:bg-gray-50 transition duration-300 ease-in-out font-bold text-lg text-gray-800 py-2 px-4 border-2 border-white rounded-md inline-flex items-center"
>
  Read More
  <svg class="w-4 h-4 ml-2" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
    <path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M14 5l7 7m0 0l-7 7m7-7H3" />
  </svg>
</button>
```
Note: I've used Tailwind CSS classes to style the button. The `bg-transparent` class sets the background color to transparent, `hover:bg-gray-50` sets the background color to a light gray on hover, `transition` and `duration-300` classes add a smooth transition effect, `ease-in-out` class adds an ease-in-out timing function, `font-bold` class sets the font weight to bold, `text-lg` class sets the font size to large, `text-gray-800` class sets the text color to a dark gray, `py-2` and `px-4` classes set the padding, `border-2` class sets the border width, `border-white` class sets the border color to white, and `rounded-md` class sets the border radius.

prompt: Product card component that displays product information, including image, price, rating, and description

message.content:
Here's the design and implementation of the Product Card component: **What should the UI look like?** The Product Card component should have a clean and minimalistic design, with a prominent product image, clear pricing and rating information, and a brief product description. The card should have a subtle shadow effect to give it depth and dimension. On smaller screens, the card should be compact and easy to scroll through, while on larger screens, the card should have more negative space to make the content breathe. **Individual Components** 1. **ProductImage** (Standalone): Displays the product image with a subtle rounded corner effect. * Mobile (sm): 100% width, aspect ratio 1:1 * Tablet (md): 100% width, aspect ratio 4:3 * Desktop (lg): 250px width, aspect ratio 4:3 2. **ProductPrice** (Standalone): Displays the product price with a highlighted background color to draw attention. * Mobile (sm): Font size 18px, padding 4px * Tablet (md): Font size 20px, padding 6px * Desktop (lg): Font size 22px, padding 8px 3. **ProductRating** (Standalone): Displays the product rating with a highlighted color to indicate the rating level. * Mobile (sm): Font size 14px, padding 2px * Tablet (md): Font size 16px, padding 4px * Desktop (lg): Font size 18px, padding 6px 4. **ProductDescription** (Takes Children): Displays the product description with a brief summary of the product. * Mobile (sm): Font size 14px, padding 4px * Tablet (md): Font size 16px, padding 6px * Desktop (lg): Font size 18px, padding 8px 5. **ProductCard** (Takes Children): The top-level component that wraps around the product image, price, rating, and description. * Mobile (sm): Width 100%, padding 12px, shadow effect * Tablet (md): Width 50%, padding 16px, shadow effect * Desktop (lg): Width 33%, padding 20px, shadow effect **Top-level HTML** ```html {product_price} {product_description} ``` **Component HTML** - **ProductImage** (Standalone): ```html ``` - **ProductPrice** (Standalone): ```html {price} ``` - **ProductRating** (Standalone): ```html = 4 ? 'green' : 'red'}-500`}>{rating} / 5 ``` - **ProductDescription** (Takes Children): ```html

{children}

``` - **ProductCard** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note: The HTML uses Tailwind CSS classes for styling and responsiveness. The `{variables}` are placeholders for the actual product data.

prompt: A breadcrumb navigation component with a light gray background

message.content:
Here's the design for the breadcrumb navigation component: **What does the UI look like?** The breadcrumb navigation component should have a light gray background and a subtle shadow to give it depth. The text should be a darker gray color to provide sufficient contrast. The component should scale well on different screen sizes, with the breadcrumb items stacking vertically on smaller screens and displaying horizontally on larger screens. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. BreadcrumbNavItem (Takes Children): This component represents a single item in the breadcrumb navigation. It should have a darker gray text color and a light gray background. On smaller screens, it should display vertically, and on larger screens, it should display horizontally. 2. Breadcrumb Nav (Takes Children): This component represents the entire breadcrumb navigation menu. It should have a light gray background and a subtle shadow. It should contain multiple BreadcrumbNavItem components. **What does the HTML for the top level UI look like?** ```html {crumb1_text} {crumb2_text} ``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - BreadcrumbNavItem (Takes Children): ```html
{children} /
``` - BreadcrumbNav (Takes Children): ```html
